common.protocol

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.protocol.Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Message protocol for the njosnari agent framework. The protocol is byte-based and supports a set of hard-coded op-codes. Sending is done to multicast UDP sockets, and parsing is done on datagram packets.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • send

        public void send(java.net.MulticastSocket socket,
                 java.net.InetAddress address,
                 int port)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Encodes this Message's contents and sends it to the given socket using a datagram packet.
        Parameters:
        socket - the socket to send this Message over
        address - the destination address
        port - the destination port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the socket cannot send this Message

      • parseMessage

        public static Message parseMessage(java.net.DatagramPacket packet)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Decodes the byte data from the given packet and constructs a new Message based on it.
        Parameters:
        packet - the datagram to parse
        Returns:
        a new message with the packet's data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the packet's input stream cannot be read
